title: Employee gets scolded after one day of failing to meet daily quota, despite years of overperforming, leading employee to do only the bare minimum until quitting: ‘They lost me as an overachiever’
description: When one works a job that requires a daily quota, the best way to manage that is by never going under that quota, but never going over it either.Not going under the daily quota is self-explanatory. If you are hired to do a certain amount of work, doing anything less than that might suggest you are not the right person for the job. However, going over the daily quota is something that some employees see as a positive. By doing more than you're actually required to do, you are proving that you are a hardworking and trustworthy employee willing to go above and beyond for the sake of the company. What is wrong with that?Well, the moment you prove to your employer that you can do more than is required, they might start getting used to this new output of work. Which means that if you ever find yourself doing anything less, management is not going to be happy about it.You shouldn't do anything more than what is expected of you, but if you are still unsure, maybe the story below will tip you over.
author: Bar Mor Hazut

title: 'She knows I'm jobless': Former employee gets rejected from ex-boss, then asked to donate to company fundraising event
description: Imagine leaving a company on great terms and being encouraged to come back should the situation arise… until it does and they reject you.If this has happened to you, surely you had a similar reaction to this author. The initial impression might be that there must have been some kind of mistake. After all, your former manager always told you that there would be a position waiting for you at the company upon your return. Maybe the hiring manager just wasn't informed, and there was an innocent mixup, right? That explanation would still be slightly embarrassing, but everyone makes mistakes. Well, for this author, it turns out that the promise of always being able to return to their former company was a bit of an over-exaggeration. Keep scrolling below to find out what happened when the author confronted their former employer, and the clueless comment their employer made next!
author: Ben Weiss

title: '[For] more than a year, I slept outside with her every night': Kind man saves a lion cub who was abandoned by her mother, hand-raises her himself for 10 years and creates an unbreakable bond with her
description: You know what one of our biggest dreams is as cat people? Cuddling with a big cat. Ugh. We know that we shouldn't, we know that it's "dangerous" or whatever, but we want to. And we have seen it happen! We have, for real. We have seen people cuddle with lions, we have seen people sleeping next to cheetahs, we have seen brave Russian women smooch huge Siberian lynxes! And yes, while it's true that most of these people are the caretakers of these animals and have grown up with them, that doesn't mean that we can't! Look at that woman. She's just a brave Russian. We can be brave too.But alas, for now, this will simply have to remain a dream for us. And we will have to live vicariously through other people - watch them cuddle with our favorite animals. We thought that we have seen all of these stories, but it seems like we haven't, because this one was completely new to us. A man rescuing a lioness cub who was abandoned by her mother an, hand-raising her himself, and forming the kind of bond with her that we are not sure we have ever seen before.
author: Mariel Ruvinsky

title: 'I was planning to rehome her, but...': Cat parent's kitten adopts even smaller rescue kitten they brought home, now their home is filled with 2x the cuteness
description: One of the most wonderful things about cats is they love to be pawrents. Cats will adopt just about anything that needs a meowther and/or father figure, including otters, bunnies, and even puppies! We, as hoomans, could learn a thing or two from their generosity. We could also learn a thing or two about their gracefulness, but that's a whole different listicle. Anyway, there's no better example than this story below featuring a kitten, an even smaller kitten, and a pawrent who got bamboozled into 2x the cuteness.We, more so than most people, understand the commitment of owning cats. The more cats you have, the more commitment it is (until you reach about four, then it's all kind of the same), so we understand it when people say they only want one cat. But after rescuing a tiny void baby and bringing it home, their cat decided to adopt it despite the pawrent's wishes to rehome it. And we all know that what the cat wants, the cat gets. Read the full thread and see more pawdorable pics below!
author: Blake Seidel

title: Buy This Game
description: When Gabriel told me that he hadn't skipped a single cutscene in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33, I sat bolt upright. Well, I slouched less - let's say that. But when he told me he was walking around and initiating dialogue with random NPCs, just to stretch it out like so many Caramellos, that's when I did the thing I said I had done initially. This is how I came to be ensorcelled by some of the Frenchest horseshit I've ever been exposed to in my life.

title: CodeSOD: Objectifying Yourself
description: "Boy, stringly typed data is hard to work with. I wish there were some easier way to work with it!" This, presumably, is what Gary's predecessor said. Followed by, "Wait, I have an idea!" public static Object createValue(String string) { Object value = parseBoolean(string); if (value != null) { return value; } value = parseInteger(string); if (value != null) { return value; } value = parseDouble(string); if (value != null) { return value; } return string; } This takes a string, and then tries to parse it, first into a boolean, failing that into an integer, and failing that into a double. Otherwise, it returns the original string. And it returns an object, which means you still get to guess what's in there even after this. You just get to guess what it returned, and hope you cast it to the correct type. Which means this almost certainly is called like this: boolean myBoolField = (Boolean)createValue(someStringContainingABool); Which makes the whole thing useless, which is fun. Gary found this code in a "long since abandoned" project, and I can't imagine why it ended up getting abandoned. [Advertisement] Keep all your packages and Docker containers in one place, scan for vulnerabilities, and control who can access different feeds. ProGet installs in minutes and has a powerful free version with a lot of great features that you can upgrade when ready.Learn more.
author: Remy Porter

title: Error'd: Que Sera, Sera
description: It's just the same refrain, over and over. "Time Travel! Again?" exclaimed David B. "I knew that Alaska is a good airline. Now I get to return at the start of a century. And not this century. The one before air flight began." To be fair, David, there never is just one first time for time travel. It's always again, isn't it?   "If it's been that long, I definitely need a holiday," headlined Craig N. "To be fair, all the destinations listed in the email were in ancient Greece, and not in countries that are younger than Jesus."   An anonymous reader reports "Upon being told my site was insecure because insufficient authorization, I clicked the provided link to read up on specifics of the problem and suggestions for how to resolve it. To my surprise, Edge blocked me, but I continued on bravely only to find...this."   Footie fan Morgan has torn his hair out over this. "For the life of me I can't work out how this table is calculated. It's not just their league either. Others have the same weird positioning of teams based on their points. It must be pointed out that this is the official TheFA website as well not just some hobbyist site." It's too late for me, but I'm frankly baffled as well.   Most Excellent Stephen is stoked to send us off with this. "Each year we have to renew the registration on our vehicles. It is not something we look forward to no matter which state you live in. A few years ago Texas introduced an online portal for this which was an improvement, if you didn't wait until the last minute of course. Recently they added a feature to the portal to track the progress of your renewal and see when they mail the sticker to you. I was pleasantly surprised to see the status page."   [Advertisement] ProGet’s got you covered with security and access controls on your NuGet feeds. Learn more.
author: Lyle Seaman

title: FBI Claims Gavel, Black Gowns Prove Ties To MS-13 Gang
description: WASHINGTON—Explaining that such items constituted a veritable uniform for the notorious criminal organization, FBI director Kash Patel claimed Monday that gavels and black gowns were sufficient evidence to tie an individual to the MS-13 gang. “For decades, MS-13 thugs have identified themselves by wearing black gowns and carrying around wooden hammers with which they could […] The post FBI Claims Gavel, Black Gowns Prove Ties To MS-13 Gang appeared first on The Onion.
